string-array.item: Java Language has four types of access modifiers.
Activity can exist in the Created State(onCreate() method).
Android Studio provides a selection of code samples.
One of the most common operators that you\'ll encounter is the simple assignment operator \"=\".
The number of attributes depends on the tag.

string-array.name: explanations
string-array.item: Java language has four types: public, protected, private and package-private. Learn more at \nhttps://docs.oracle.com/javase/tutorial/java/javaOO/accesscontrol.html

Activity can exist essentially only in three states: resumed(onResume()), paused(onPause), stopped(onStop).Learn more at \nhttps://developer.android.com/guide/components/activities/activity-lifecycle.html#lc

The Code Sample Browser in Android Studio helps you find high-quality, Google-provided Android code samples based on the currently highlighted symbol in your project.Learn more at \nhttps://developer.android.com/studio/write/sample-code.html

Some tags donâ€™t have attributes at all, others could have many of them. Moreover, some attributes are necessary, other are optional. Learn more at \nhttps://developer.android.com/reference/android/R.attr.html
We are using framework method as a black box. Google engineers have already implemented for us.
boolean parseBoolean (String s)\n The boolean returned represents the value true if the string argument is not null and is equal, ignoring case, to the string "true".
In Android Studio, we can set one breakpoint per method.", 0, "We can add more breakpoints as we want.Learn more at \nhttps://developer.android.com/studio/debug/index.html
Borderless buttons resemble basic buttons except that they have no borders or background.Learn more at \nhttps://developer.android.com/guide/topics/ui/controls/button.html#Style")
